content.protection: Pro to 4" most anchors are off of bomber trees.
content.location:
Start 100 yards right of the Altar Buttress route, just right of a large left trending chimney system which is the main feature separating the beginning of The Altar Buttress from The Paisley Buttress.

The first pitch of the route starts via a cool right facing flake and quickly turns into a finger crack that jogs left then, straight up again to a loose boulder struned  ledge.

content.description:
Obvious water worn low angle grey chimney system 500 feet to the right of the Altar Buttress on the North face of The Altar of Algoot.

Decent blocky climbing gets you to the middle fun section where you pull some steep chimney and steaming moves ending just before the Black Tower of the Altar Buttress route.
content.location:
Obvious chimney feature making up the recess between the start of the Altar Buttress Â and the start of the Paisley Buttress.

Descend via one rappel off of tree into Altar Gully at base of Black Tower pitch.

content.protection: Standard traditional rack gear to 3", 5" if you want to fire the direct 10a variation to the Black Tower Pitch!
content.location: "Start as low and direct at the obvious toe of this giant elegant buttress via a super clean 5.4 finger crack. Throughout the entirety of this route bailing is fairly easy usually only requiring one -two rappels off the east side of the buttress. If you do make it to the summit, (Yes it has a bitchen technical summit) a single 30m rappel is required off the east side."
